'''Swoobat''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ココロモリ''' ''Kokoromori'') is a dual-type {{2t|Psychic|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Woobat}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]].

==Biology==
[[File:Robert Swoobat sleeping.png|thumb|left|220px|Swoobat sleeping]]
Swoobat is a blue, bat-like Pokémon. It has fused, pointed ears with striated, lighter colored insides and a pink, heart-shaped snout with a single nostril. Swoobat's nose can produce many different ultrasonic waves. When it shakes its tail vigorously, it is producing sound waves powerful enough to destroy concrete. In contrast, it produces waves during courtship that can gladden any who hear it. Two wide, rounded teeth are visible in its lower jaw. A mane of shaggy, light blue fur surrounds its neck. Its black wings have a claw at the joint, and its small black feet have three toes each. It has a bare, pink tail that is twisted with two short prongs at the tip. In the anime, it is seen to hang from this tail rather than its feet as it sleeps.

==In the anime==
[[File:Swoobat anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Swoobat in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
A group of Swoobat debuted in ''[[BW024|Emolga the Irresistible!]]''. They were angry with {{TP|Iris|Emolga}} for disturbing their peace and chased her, {{an|Iris}}, and {{TP|Iris|Axew}} down. However, [[Ash's Pikachu]] and Emolga were able to take them down.

A Swoobat appeared in ''[[BW054|The Four Seasons of Sawsbuck!]]'', under the ownership of {{OBP|Robert|BW054}}.

[[Skyla]]'s Swoobat appeared in ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'', where it battled {{an|Cilan}}'s {{TP|Cilan|Pansage}} and won with ease. However, it was defeated by {{TP|Cilan|Crustle}} right afterwards. It reappeared in ''[[BW068|An Amazing Aerial Battle!]]'', where it was used in a battle against {{Ash}}. It easily defeated his {{AP|Krokorok}}, but then lost to his {{AP|Tranquill}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Swoobat appeared in ''[[BW105|Lost at the League!]]''.

A group of Swoobat appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Swoobat appeared in the ending credits of ''[[PK25|Eevee & Friends]]''.

A Swoobat appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'', where it was competing in the [[Pokémon Sky Relay]].

A Swoobat appeared in ''[[XY092|Cloudy Fate, Bright Future!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Psychic}}.

[[File:Skyla Swoobat Adventures.png|110px|thumb|Swoobat in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Swoobat appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where it was one of the kidnapped Pokémon found in a stronghold and was later returned to its trainer.

[[Skyla]] owns a Swoobat which first appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]''. It was used to battle {{adv|Black}} in a Gym battle.

A Swoobat appeared in ''[[PS511|Dream a Little Dream]]''.

==Trivia==
* Swoobat's evolutionary line has several similarities with {{p|Crobat}}'s. All of the members of the lines are based on bats and reach their respective final evolutionary form by [[friendship]].

===Origin===
Swoobat appears to based on a {{wp|Pteropus|flying fox}} and a {{wp|heart-nosed bat}}.

====Name origin====
Swoobat may be a combination of ''swoon'' or ''swoop'' and ''bat''. Its English name containing the English name of its pre-evolved form ({{p|Woobat}}) mirrors how its Japanese name (Kokoromori) contains the Japanese name of its pre-evolved form (Koromori).

Kokoromori may be a combination of {{tt|心|こころ}} ''kokoro'' (heart) and コウモリ ''kōmori'' (bat).
